comments.commentBody: Martin, I had lunch today with Charles. It was our last lunch before he retires officially. Before lunch, however, I went to our common barber, Sam, located in the Civic Opera Building. Sam was actually introduced to me by my friend George back when I worked across the street. It was purely coincidental that Charles and I wound up with the same barber. Sam works with two or three other barbers, depending on their business. Apparently they just hired a new barber. Some young man in a suit came in and asked about getting a haircut. Sam greeted him and immediately sat him in the empty chair next to mine. A few minutes later the new barber returned with some coffee and immediately went over to the stranger. They started a conversation and I couldn't help overhearing some of it. The customer introduced himself. His name was DYLAN. He spelled it out.
Very cool.  What year was that?  (Sound of creaking door.)

.
This guy was always welcome in the valley, as a guest.

Chicago connection as well.

I would look a bit deeper.  He didnt become rich, famous or a master manipulator by being a buffoon.  He knows the numbers, he doesnt NEED to do this debate.  In fact by skipping it, he once again becomes the headline and all anyone will talk about is Trump Trump Trump.  His strong suit is not debates, quite the contrary, at debates they ask too many questions, while at rallys they simply cheer cheer cheer.  Donald Trump is playing to his strengths and he has the world following after him at every turn.

I would look a bit deeper.  He didnt become rich, famous or a master manipulator by being a buffoon.  He knows the numbers, he doesnt NEED to do this debate.  In fact by skipping it, he once again becomes the headline and all anyone will talk about is Trump Trump Trump.  His strong suit is not debates, quite the contrary, at debates they ask too many questions, while at rallys they simply cheer cheer cheer.  Donald Trump is playing to his strengths and he has the world following after him at every turn.

"He didnt become rich, famous or a master manipulator by being a buffoon"

No, definitely not. Trump got rich the old fashioned way: he inherited it. As to being a buffoon, buffoon is as buffoon does, and buffoonery is certainly one of Trump's strengths. I'll leave it at that.

I wouldn't have participated either, it's about the direspect shown by the channel folks. Trump is just being consistent, you can't campaign to make america great again and respected again and let an orgamization publicly toy with you on Twitter.
I've think he'll get out of it lifted as people will give him credit for leadership and authority.

Hahahahaha! This comment is hilarious!
There are many terms I’d use to describe Trump’s hissy fit, but “leadership” is definitely not one of them (“consistent,” however, is one of them).
Fox may be in the gutter, but Trump is right down there with them.

I wouldn't have participated either, it's about the direspect shown by the channel folks. Trump is just being consistent, you can't campaign to make america great again and respected again and let an orgamization publicly toy with you on Twitter.
I've think he'll get out of it lifted as people will give him credit for leadership and authority.

Hahahahaha! This comment is hilarious!
There are many terms I’d use to describe Trump’s hissy fit, but “leadership” is definitely not one of them (“consistent,” however, is one of them).
Fox may be in the gutter, but Trump is right down there with them.

Except for his small band of rabid supporters the real story here is that Trump generates an astonishing amount of disrespect, derision and contempt towards himself. How can anyone expect him to function on the world stage when people hate him so much?

I must admit that as each day goes by, the GOP race resembles a soap opera, like "Dynasty". Mr. Trump won't debate, because he felt he had bad treatment by FOX News.

I wonder what happens when there is a world crisis, and Mr. Trump is mocked by our enemies? He is not going to talk with him, because he was offended?

And a president is suppose to be mature, strong and brave? Be a leader of our troops?

Mr. Trump is afraid, for no better word, to face FOX News again. Well, like all bullies, they are cowards within.

I wonder what happens when there is a world crisis, and Mr. Trump is mocked by our enemies? He is not going to talk with him, because he was offended?

And a president is suppose to be mature, strong and brave? Be a leader of our troops?

Mr. Trump is afraid, for no better word, to face FOX News again. Well, like all bullies, they are cowards within.

Donald Trump outsmarted Fox News. The statement released by Fox News was totally inappropriate. Trump couldn't back away from Megan Kelly, but the decision by Fox to release an unprofessional statement ridiculing Trump,and by implication,his supporters was gave him the excuse he needed. Trump can now justify his no show, demonize the media, and host his own event. He avoids any possible mistakes and takes attention away from the other candidates. He,in effect,runs out the clock,while leading in the polls.

Outsmarting Fox News? Now there's a tough task.

Mr. Trump has done the impossible: Made Fox News look like respectable journalists (kind of), at least for the next 48 hours.

Donald Trump outsmarted Fox News. The statement released by Fox News was totally inappropriate. Trump couldn't back away from Megan Kelly, but the decision by Fox to release an unprofessional statement ridiculing Trump,and by implication,his supporters was gave him the excuse he needed. Trump can now justify his no show, demonize the media, and host his own event. He avoids any possible mistakes and takes attention away from the other candidates. He,in effect,runs out the clock,while leading in the polls.
Not really Don Shipp.... Trump just showed his hand in a poker game.  Keep hitting on his misogynistic nature and.... he loses the election in a LANDSLIDE.
If Fox is "news," what I pick up from my dog is the finest chocolate.
Can't argue with anything that uses the words "Fox" ,"Trump", and "unprofessional" in the same sentence.

You are right H-OB, Trump would follow the footsteps of that other NY Republican, Rudy Giuliani, and grandstand about not meeting people. Admirable, selfless, leadership strategy, right?
Take care.

You are right H-OB, Trump would follow the footsteps of that other NY Republican, Rudy Giuliani, and grandstand about not meeting people. Admirable, selfless, leadership strategy, right?
Take care.

Trump was right - again. I never heard of a news organization putting out such an insane statement about a political candidate. Trump's negative opinion of everyone at Fox is obviously correct. He doesn't need this debate. But we need him to be our next president. Go Trump!

Trump was right - again. I never heard of a news organization putting out such an insane statement about a political candidate. Trump's negative opinion of everyone at Fox is obviously correct. He doesn't need this debate. But we need him to be our next president. Go Trump!
He is afraid of women. He's not afraid of Megyn Kelly, so much as he's afraid of saying the wrong thing and getting hammered again. Scared rabbit.

I can't believe this article didn't mention the reason for Trump backing out until halfway through. I was taught in fifth grade that the most important facts of the story should be in the first paragraph.
It was the press release comment from Fox News, I've never seen anything like it in my life. I'm done with station. How childish, they're not supposed to sarcastic to candidate. They should have just said nothing or said we stand by our moderators.
Trumps event will get more ratings than the debate anyway. Probably picked up by CNN.

Mr. Trumps caricature draws more media attention than any important national issue from anyone's consideration. Mr. Trump's predictable unpredictability will keep the media busy let everything else go down the drain. Mr. Trump is a good fit for the soap opera addict population. Real issues like low wage, crumbling infrastructure, spiraling health care costs nothing deserves attention because issues like that do not draw audience. Somehow I think, Mr. Trump is a good fit for US presidency under the circumstances. After all, we the people deserve to be entertained, let everything else go down the drain.

Echoes of Ross Perot! I remember when Perot briefly halted his third-party bid for the presidency in 1992, because he was unhappy with some potential media coverage of family issues. The menacing stories either did or didn't happen -- and then Perot tried to get back in the race. But the Perot bubble had popped, and he never got it reflated.

Being the President is a nonstop job. There's no end of irritants and indignities that may come the way of our Commander in Chief. The best presidents rise above it. Even the not-so-good ones press on, somehow. Business people may talk a tough game, but when the ups and downs of a campaign turn them into no-shows, their ability to win over voters disintegrates.

The menacing stories either did or didn't happen -- and then Perot tried to get back in the race. But the Perot bubble had popped, and he never got it reflated.

Even the not-so-good ones press on, somehow. Business people may talk a tough game, but when the ups and downs of a campaign turn them into no-shows, their ability to win over voters disintegrates.

Will the Board of Directors (the RNC) please vote to remove this guy once and for all?  And take the slick talking Texan/Canadian out as well.  Disgrace to the Republican Party or what was the Republican Party.  Be done with them.

And President Obama has demonstrated how it is best done -- with grace, intelligence, wisdom, class, maturity, and pursuing what he perceives to be in the best interests of the country, with few nods to special interests. I join many of NYT commenters in saying, "Mr. President, I miss you already."
I will gladly give Donald that chance to learn.  He's so much more qualified in every possible way than the bozo in office now.

Hard to understand why any woman would want to vote for this misogynist. And women comprise some 52% of the electorate!
Then there are all the Latinos, all the Muslims, all the liberals, all the gays, etc. Who's left, other than straight white, non-Muslim, conservative males -- who all the other GOP candidates are also fighting over? How can Trump even be in the running??
We're living in strange times.
Many women DO like him!?
Sure, neither one has anything to do with most of our ideas of the best of America anyway. Let them both sink.
His event will do better ratings and he will get 2 hours all to himself
Watching Michael Moore fawning over Megyn Kelly and the absolute hypocrisy it displayed says it all.
